content: Very considerate of him to visit the troops. ++http://www.foxnews.com/politics/first100days/2009/04/07/president-obama-makes-surprise-visit-iraq/ quote: President Obama all but declared victory in Iraq Tuesday, telling U.S. troops at Camp Victory that even though he opposed the war, they had given Iraq an opportunity to stand on its own as a democratic country. That, he said, is an extraordinary achievement. "Here's a couple things I want to say. Number one, thank you," the president bellowed as he addressed troops during a surprise visit to Iraq at the tail end of a marathon overseas trip. Obama said the next 18 months are critical to the mission. U.S. troops are expected to be out of the country by the end of 2010. "You've kept your eyes focused on just doing your job and because of that, every mission that's been assigned, from getting rid of Saddam to reducing violence to stabilizing the country to facilitating elections, you have given Iraq the opportunity to stand on its own as a democratic country. That is an extraordinary achievement and for that you have the thanks of the American people," he said. "It is time for us to transfer to the Iraqis. They need to take responsibility for their country," he said, adding that the U.S. role is to train Iraqis to take control of their own country so "we can start bringing our folks home." Obama spoke for just six minutes with the nearly 700 troops who gathered at the base that was formerly a palace for Saddam Hussein. Obama met with National Security Adviser James Jones; the head of command in Iraq Gen. Ray Odierno and others before walking out into the glitzy, over-the-top main room where troops gathered under a huge chandelier and intricate gold work. Obama's appearance pleased troops interviewed by reporters. They said they were gratified the new president came to visit so soon after taking office. "We love you," shouted a few troops. THe president The president landed in Baghdad late Tuesday afternoon for his first trip to Iraq as president -- his third overall. His visit comes as he begins to execute plans... (...) content: quote: Very considerate of him to visit the troops. Considerate? Perhaps an obligation I would venture. And while I respect this action absolutely, having been on the receiving end of political/presidential dog and pony shows in a war zone, consideration was the last thing I felt was being shown to me. But that's just me. I couldn't wait to get away from all that brass and back to my real job.
quote: Very considerate of him to visit the troops.
reply: Considerate? Perhaps an obligation I would venture. And while I respect this action absolutely, having been on the receiving end of political/presidential dog and pony shows in a war zone, consideration was the last thing I felt was being shown to me. But that's just me. I couldn't wait to get away from all that brass and back to my real job.

content: quote: President Obama all but declared victory in Iraq Tuesday, telling U.S. troops at Camp Victory that even though he opposed the war, they had given Iraq an opportunity to stand on its own as a democratic country. That, he said, is an extraordinary achievement. "Here's a couple things I want to say. Number one, thank you," the president bellowed as he addressed troops during a surprise visit to Iraq at the tail end of a marathon overseas trip. Obama said the next 18 months are critical to the mission. U.S. troops are expected to be out of the country by the end of 2010. "You've kept your eyes focused on just doing your job and because of that, every mission that's been assigned, from getting rid of Saddam to reducing violence to stabilizing the country to facilitating elections, you have given Iraq the opportunity to stand on its own as a democratic country. That is an extraordinary achievement and for that you have the thanks of the American people," he said. "It is time for us to transfer to the Iraqis. They need to take responsibility for their country," he said, adding that the U.S. role is to train Iraqis to take control of their own country so "we can start bringing our folks home." It's amazing what was accomplished during the surge that wasn't working...

title: Obama makes surprise visit to US troops in Iraq after Turkey visit

content: quote: Originally posted by M1Lase_n_Blaze: quote: Very considerate of him to visit the troops. Considerate? Perhaps an obligation I would venture. And while I respect this action absolutely, having been on the receiving end of political/presidential dog and pony shows in a war zone, consideration was the last thing I felt was being shown to me. But that's just me. I couldn't wait to get away from all that brass and back to my real job. There are a lot of politicians who do it for different reasons. The most fun visits are the ones where the principal tries to avoid as much fanfare as possible and just wants to spend time in ways that are mutually beneficial. The worst visits are the ones where, through all the fanfare, the primary reason for the visit is to enhance the prestige of the principal. Almost everyone sees right through those - and those types of visits are the ones that the rank and file can't wait to end.
quote: Originally posted by M1Lase_n_Blaze: quote: Very considerate of him to visit the troops. Considerate? Perhaps an obligation I would venture. And while I respect this action absolutely, having been on the receiving end of political/presidential dog and pony shows in a war zone, consideration was the last thing I felt was being shown to me. But that's just me. I couldn't wait to get away from all that brass and back to my real job.
reply: There are a lot of politicians who do it for different reasons. The most fun visits are the ones where the principal tries to avoid as much fanfare as possible and just wants to spend time in ways that are mutually beneficial. The worst visits are the ones where, through all the fanfare, the primary reason for the visit is to enhance the prestige of the principal. Almost everyone sees right through those - and those types of visits are the ones that the rank and file can't wait to end.
title: Obama makes surprise visit to US troops in Iraq after Turkey visit

That's what all the speeches, all the press briefings, the UN presentation, and the AUMF stated. The democracy piece came after the WMD hunt came up empty.
quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: I'm just glad that a Democrat finally realizes that we accomplished what we went there for. Now maybe the rest will follow his suit, probably not, but a thought for you Dems.
reply: Ahem...We went there to rid Saddam of his WMD capability. That's what all the speeches, all the press briefings, the UN presentation, and the AUMF stated. The democracy piece came after the WMD hunt came up empty.

content: I came home yesterday from the Va Hospital to hear this Dog and Pony show of a speech in Iraq.What got me the most was truly how out of touch Obama is with the military when he makes the statement of how much we miss not being at home, seeing children,family, holidays, Blah blah, blah, Yes that is something we sure do miss and we know that and our families know that when we sign up but he doesn't get it because he has always been able to live in The Freeiest Country in The World because we have The Best Folks in the World willing to make sure we keep these Freedoms, and now I may be State side and a Disabled Vet I don't take a single day for granted and Thank everyone of You still keeping us Safe, I say a Prayer for you every night and Hope maybe someday the rest will understand what we and our families are willing to give. God Bless the U.S.A.

Now maybe the rest will follow his suit, probably not, but a thought for you Dems. Ahem...We went there to rid Saddam of his WMD capability. That's what all the speeches, all the press briefings, the UN presentation, and the AUMF stated. The democracy piece came after the WMD hunt came up empty.
quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: I'm just glad that a Democrat finally realizes that we accomplished what we went there for. Now maybe the rest will follow his suit, probably not, but a thought for you Dems.
reply: Ahem...We went there to rid Saddam of his WMD capability. That's what all the speeches, all the press briefings, the UN presentation, and the AUMF stated. The democracy piece came after the WMD hunt came up empty.
title: Obama makes surprise visit to US troops in Iraq after Turkey visit

title: Obama makes surprise visit to US troops in Iraq after Turkey visit

content: I came home yesterday from the Va Hospital to hear this Dog and Pony show of a speech in Iraq.What got me the most was truly how out of touch Obama is with the military when he makes the statement of how much we miss not being at home, seeing children,family, holidays, Blah blah, blah, Yes that is something we sure do miss and we know that and our families know that when we sign up but he doesn't get it because he has always been able to live in The Freeiest Country in The World because we have The Best Folks in the World willing to make sure we keep these Freedoms, and now I may be State side and a Disabled Vet I don't take a single day for granted and Thank everyone of You still keeping us Safe, I say a Prayer for you every night and Hope maybe someday the rest will understand what we and our families are willing to give. God Bless the U.S.A.
reply: I came home yesterday from the Va Hospital to hear this Dog and Pony show of a speech in Iraq.What got me the most was truly how out of touch Obama is with the military when he makes the statement of how much we miss not being at home, seeing children,family, holidays, Blah blah, blah, Yes that is something we sure do miss and we know that and our families know that when we sign up but he doesn't get it because he has always been able to live in The Freeiest Country in The World because we have The Best Folks in the World willing to make sure we keep these Freedoms, and now I may be State side and a Disabled Vet I don't take a single day for granted and Thank everyone of You still keeping us Safe, I say a Prayer for you every night and Hope maybe someday the rest will understand what we and our families are willing to give.
